description: Unique vendor identifier used across the system and integrations.
Vendor’s legal or doing-business-as name.
Primary street address for the vendor’s business or remittance location.
City associated with the vendor’s address.
State or province code for the vendor’s address.
Postal or ZIP code for the vendor’s address.
Primary business telephone number for the vendor.
Vendor fax number.
Free-text notes about the vendor, services, or account details.
Yes/No flag indicating the vendor is a corporation; confirm with SME whether this denotes legal entity type or corporate account status.
Vendor tax identification number (e.g., EIN or equivalent) for compliance and reporting.
Vendor business or trade license number or identifier.
Vendor group/type classification used for reporting, approvals, or pricing; likely controlled list; confirm with SME.
Internal vendor performance or risk rating used for selection and oversight; confirm scale and criteria with SME.
Primary email address for vendor communications such as orders, invoices, or support.
Electronic data interchange (EDI) address or endpoint identifier for automated transactions; confirm with SME.
Billing terms, instructions, or billing contact details associated with the vendor; confirm with SME.
User-defined field 1 for custom vendor attributes configured by the business.
User-defined field 2 for custom vendor attributes configured by the business.
User-defined field 3 for custom vendor attributes configured by the business.
User-defined field 4 for custom vendor attributes configured by the business.
User-defined field 5 for custom vendor attributes configured by the business.
User-defined field 6 for custom vendor attributes configured by the business.
Default invoiced labor rate this vendor charges (currency per hour) used for service entries; confirm units and applicability with SME.
Default invoiced parts rate (e.g., discount or markup percentage) for this vendor; confirm calculation basis with SME.
Default sales/use tax rate to apply to purchases from this vendor.
Alternate vendor identifier used by legacy systems or external partners.
User who created the vendor record.
Timestamp when the vendor record was created.
User who last updated the vendor record.
Timestamp of the most recent update to the vendor record.
Identifier linking this vendor record to stored attachments or documents.
Indicates whether the vendor is active and selectable in transactions.
Primary contact person at the vendor.
Vendor website URL.
After-hours support contact name or instructions for reaching the vendor outside normal business hours.
After-hours contact phone number for the vendor.
Mobile phone number for the vendor’s contact.
Secondary address line (suite, unit, building, or additional mailing details).
Vendor type/category used for classification and reporting (e.g., parts supplier, service provider); confirm with SME.
